reviews.review: Bon jeu, surtout avec des amis, mais serveurs perfectibles

I'd highly suggest a single player mode, this would play favor to those trying to learn and adjust to the game while not being hounded by players with the vast experience over other newer players. With addition to the character dynamics, it should host more light hearted experiences for people to prepare themselves. It is fun if you have a group prepared but is horrid if you are a killer looking for the chance to learn. Or even get the vibe, the monsters are unique and have potential to be fun for everyone, if not scarier. But not understanding the more intricate aspects can stifle the gaming and ruin the desire to come back. 

With friends you can get a solid 4.5/5

Alone, the drive dwindles and essentially brings the feeling of lackluster plays to an all time high. 2/5

When you get the chance to be a Killer and don't encounter the many issues you do during match makings, such as automatic booting and a drastic lag spikes. 3/5. The idea of putting any skill you have to work against others is thrilling, and it shows when each character has time put into them. The fact alone that a match can end in seconds because the only players still playing are decked beyond what a new comer could hope to handle.

Pretty good job so far! Thumbs up~ Must play. 10/10
It is a very fun and enjoyable game.

Good mechanics, not overly complex, and good replay value.
Get this game on sale (it goes on sale often) if you enjoy a spoopy thrill.

Oh boy,

This game is a lot of things. It's poorly designed, broken, and buggy as all hell. It has some of the best art direction I've ever seen, complemented by bad implementation all over the place. The gameplay can either be some of the most thrilling ever, or it can put you to sleep. I've gotta break it down.


Gameplay:

I would normally give a rating, but this part is too complex to even rate. 

As a killer and survivor (obviously) the gameplay and feel can change drastically based on which killer you are playing as/against. 

The survivor gameplay is fun and the feeling of outwitting the other player is often fun and thrilling (this goes for the killer as well)

One of the truly amazing aspects of this game is the unique ways you have to adapt and respond to each killer, and while several killers can be countered using the same methods (using line of sight and faking different directions) at the very least you have to have intimate knowledge of how each killers' powers work or you are in for a very bad time, so in terms of the learning curve, you do have a hill to climb.


When it comes to playing as the killer, this aspect is dulled to some degree, you ARE the unique element. If you play the same killer over and over you often won't experience this, and the map generation isn't so random that each game won't share significant similarities (but don't mistake this for each map being too set, the different maps, and different iterations of these maps and different playstyles of all survivors are quite enough to keep it fresh for a long time)

Important to mention, the game style of the individual killer can make or break games. Succinctly, a camping killer can make the game super boring. Doesn't lose you the game, but makes it super boring. 

Gameplay (Balance):

AHHH don't even get me started. This is so much to unravel it could break my mind. To keep it short and sweet, matches will and often are unbalanced. The map generation will randomly place the structures and it can and will be broken in either direction. You could have zero chance as a survivor OR get absolutely demolished as the killer and YOU have ZERO control over this. 

Not to mention there is a gap as large as the ocean between the power levels of each killer.

A good nurse will demolish almost every single match without giving them a chance (in all fairness nurse is by far the hardest killer to learn, but that's not an excuse for being broken)

A PERFECT wraith can get demolished even if played perfectly since good, coordinated survivors can just straight up give you no chance.

There are a million perks at this point in the game's life cycle and expect to use about a dozen since for every good perk there are about 6 horrible ones.

Let's move on, in summary, don't expect a balanced experience. At all.

Art and Music

In general, every single killer oozes personality and is completely unique. BHVR's ability to create unique personalities, again and again, is truly world-class in my opinion. While many are similar in power, no killer looks remotely like another. Each is recognized at a glance, each has its own unique sounds and different animations (besides standardized things like breaking pallets and such)

The music is excellent, and the art direction of almost every map leaves nothing to be desired (unlike the actual design lol)

One serious complaint I can levy is that oftentimes the animation leaves much to be desired. There's nothing seriously wrong, but they're a lot of placeholder animations that don't make sense in the context. As well there's a kind of lack of life from these dead men, and the animations often don't ooze the oomph they should given the fact that they're often shattering wooden structures and cleaving survivors. Survivor animations are well done, no real complaints tbh it's hard to really mess up. They do lack a bit of life, but they're nothing to complain about.

The sound design is excellent, every hit sounds crunchy and hurtful. Voice lines are well done (although the survivors can often sound a bit silly)

Game feel and other points:

For the most part, the game feel is well enough. I have some complaints about the jankyness of certain killers. Pyramid head feels like garbage to use his power with, the trickster's recoil is all camera recoil, which often leaves it feeling somewhat jarring to use his power.

Don't expect good game balance decisions from these devs, just don't. If you play this game, and you have problems enough with the balance that you can't handle it; you should most likely just refund cause it hasn't really gotten that much better in 5 years. It's light years ahead now, but it just takes ages for any good and reasonable change to take place. Additionally, they repeatedly release content that is lackluster or is something that no one wants and is actively bad.

Conclusion:

I have enjoyed my time with this game, and it has given me memories and even a few friends. If I could go back I would buy it again in a heartbeat. It has plenty of appeal, but it's not an easy game to start with (expect to get demolished for a while especially as a survivor). It holds a special, frustrating place in my heart.

As someone who has played this game for a while and has really stopped playing at this point, I can definitively say that this will be a good purchase for you.

There are pros and cons to this game, lots of cons. But it is a (mostly) enjoyable survival horror.

The mechanics (fundamentally) are good. Although some perks and add-ons feel can feel unfair at times.

The community, though, can be quite toxic, although there are some really nice people out there, you just gotta find them.

You'll be glad to know cheaters are 99.9% nonexistent. Honestly do not worry about running into a script kiddie.

The bloodweb is a very innovative and fun way of levelling up. As you spend your bloodpoints, you have to choose wisely about what you will purchase next, as the entity will take what you don't. This becomes a small game of it's own. 

The game is NOT pay to win. However please note that lots of characters are dlc, but all the characters/ you really need are already in the base game. 

Please if you need any advice at all going in is that you should take everything with a pinch of salt. Or a couple bowlfulls.
Have fun playing this game, make an effort to lighten others' days up, even if that person is flinging insults left, right and center.

this game is absolute dog shit. the killers literally have an advantage like no other i have seen in any other game i have ever played in my entire life. Good idea for the game but honestly one of the worst survival horror games I have tried. CASTLE MINER Z IS A BETTER SURVIVAL GAME. To end my rant the real issue i have with this game is that you can spawn in with a good killer and absolutely wreck everyone in the game, and you could be a max level survivor with 300 hours and still get dunked on by a noob. F DBD. The only good thing about this game is customization is pretty good i guess. 1/10

Review update 29/may/2020
Every update is a survivor nerf. 
After i got 5 lvl surve there is a lot of campers, and developers approve them to do it. They decreased engineer boxes and first aids,so they become really useless.
And after one of the latest updates, they even more made live of the survivors just impossible to save when the camper staying right next to the hoocked guy. 
Before, they just hited us and we had a little chanse to escape, but now they just interrupt our saving motion without any chance to save.
I'll try to play a bit more, but it seems like i'll stop to play it soon.
And maybe rarely i'd play as a killer.

Review update 10/10/2020
I can't stop play this game guys coz it's great!
It has a lot of updates among the time, developers work quite hard and always do some events, create new characters with new abilities, creating new maps, updating grafics, creating new books with bunches of new missions.
I really appreciate it.
May be i can't stop coz it's always fresh.

It still great!!

Primeiramente, Bom dia/Boa tarde/Boa noite.
Segundamente, gostaria de dizer que esse jogo possui diversos prós e contras, sendo os contras principalmente o desbalanceamento nas partidas e as hitboxes que são totalmente zoadas. Porém, existem diversos prós, como por exemplo: variedade de personagens e habilidades que podem ser equipadas, grande quantidade de mapas mapas e possui relativamente bastante conteúdo, além de ser muito divertido de se jogar com os amigos.
Espero ter ajudado com essa análise.
Juego muy bueno y mas con amigos, es lindo, lo recomiendo

Honestly do not buy this game it can be fun but it has too many problems which are ignored by the developer. These problems hinder the gameplay and make half of the games you play really frustrating. Especially the killer side of the gameplay has massive problems which make the game really unfun in higher ranks (tho ppl usually say "git good" or "you are just a bad killer" to counter these arguments).

I love love love this game! Not only are the graphics great, but the loading time that the server takes to connect you to matches is much faster than what expected. Knew about this game for a while but I had never played it myself, so glad I bought it!

Dead by daylight- командная игра, у каждого своя роль,  давай те поговорим о выживших,  главная задача выживших завести генераторы, задача мана повесить сурвов на крюк и не дать сбежать,  вроде легко звучит,  но у каждого игрока в матче своя роль, кто то мансит,  кто то спасает, кто то заводит генераторы,  многие играют в пати,  в том числе и я,  можно и соло но это будет сложнее,  так как не будет инфы,  с каждым матчем, появляется новые эмоции, я рекомендую эту игру,  но есть и минусы: баги, хиты за километр, кемперы.  У меня всё!
